alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:05PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin and Bear Lake Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 504 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Franklin, or 11 miles east of Preston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montpelier, Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Saint Charles, Dingle, Paris, Bloomington, Minnetonka Cave, Ovid, Border Summit, Mapleton, Geneva, Fish Haven, Pegram, and Geneva Summit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Bear Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region
